result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darius Latrail Wade

records.addlTxt: Final Pretrial set for 1/13/2023 at 10:30 am is rescheduled by the court pursuant to State's request, and with approval of Defense counsel, to 1/13/2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Darius Latrail Wade.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for motion hearing on Defense Motion to Suppress Evidence Obtained via Search Warrant (Franks-Mann).  Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES the defense Motion.  Defense requests date for Jury Trial and Final Pretrial be set.  Court sets the deadline of 1/6/2023 for filing of Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine, Witness lists and Change of Plea forms.  Court sets deadline of 10/17/2022 for State to turnover DNA. State ordered to turnover Crime Lab Reports on or before final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Br. 9. Final pre-trial scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 10:30 am. Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-05-2022, filed
State's Response to Defendant's Motion  to Suppress, filed.
Court order increase of Cash Bond in amount of $100.00.  All prior conditions remain in full force and effect, with turnover to Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision.

Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Darius Latrail Wade.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court to address recent Justice Point Violation. Discussion held. Court increases Cash Bail an additional $100.00 with same conditions and turnover to Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision. Defendant remanded into custody.

Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Motion hearing set for 10/6/2022 at 1:30 pm remains calendared.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 9.12.22, filed.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence Obtained via Search Warrant, filed.
Court order increase of Cash Bond in amount of $100.00.  All prior conditions remain in full force and effect.

Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Darius Latrail Wade.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court to address recent Justice Point Violation. Discussion held. Court increases Cash Bail an additional $100.00 with same conditions. Defendant remanded into custody.

Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Motion hearing set for 10/6/2022 at 1:30 pm remains calendared.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 08-25-2022, filed.

BRANCH 16 FOR BRANCH 09
Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in court, without counsel.  Present in court is Justice Point Ashley Dahl.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Justice Point Violation.  Defendant to report to Justice Point on Thursday, August 25, 2022, in morning, for drug screening test; Justice Point to notify Branch 9 if negative results.  No action taken at this time.  Motion hearing remains calendared for October 6, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 08-22-2022, filed.

Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.   Defense intends on filing Motion to Suppress. Court sets 8/29/2022 deadline for filing motions and 9/26/2022 deadline for State to file a response.  

Matter adjourned to Br. 9 for motion hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 08-05-2022, filed.

Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in court with Attorney Theodore OReilly; both appear by video.  Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 19CF1988 & 19CF76. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Malafa. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk

Attorney Theodore OReilly in court, defendant Darius Latrail Wade not in court, in custody, HOC.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status of counsel.  Defendant unavailable for Zoom and Attorney OReilly waives the appearance for today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JPS report
Theodore OReilly

Turnover to JUSTICE POINT Level 5. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription; maintain absolute sobriety. Comply with drug and alcohol testing by Justice Point. No possession of dangerous weapons, firearms, ammunition or magazines. Not to reside in any location where a firearm is present. Not to be in an automobile where any firearm is present. Must comply with all conditions of bail in all other pending cases.

Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in court with attorney Jason A Findling as a representative of the State Public Defender's Office.  Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darius Latrail Wade appeared by video means. Defendant has new charges pending. State is requesting a cash bond, defense is requesting signature bond remain as previously set. Court sets $1,500 cash bail. Conditions stated on record and to be put into bond entry. Case is adjourned in Branch 17 for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 6-15-2022

Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a indigency hearing. Defendant reports wanting a public defender assigned to his case. Court orders defendant to go to the public defenders office in person to obtain a public defender. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Filed, Pretrial Services Supervision Report  5.19.22.
Indigency hearing on May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in court by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant refused SPD appointement and has not retained counsel.  Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4.26.22

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darius Latrail Wade appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense motion to dismiss count 1. Court DENY motion to dismiss as to count 1.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
